# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(words) > 0 && length(word) + length(words[end]) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end

        lines[end] *= text_width > length(lines[end]) ? length(lines[end]) + 1 : length(lines[end])
        lines[end] *= words[end]

        lines[end] = split(lines[end], " ")[1:end-1] * " " * word
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. The sun sets behind the hill.")
```

Output:

```
"The quick brown fox jumps over the
 lazy dog. The sun sets behind the hill."
```
